1: <sup>1</sup> Every wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.
2: <sup>2</sup> He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the LORD: but he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.
3: <sup>3</sup> In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride: but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.
4: <sup>4</sup> Where no oxen are, the crib is clean: but much increase is by the strength of the ox.
5: <sup>5</sup> A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.
6: <sup>6</sup> A scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not: but knowledge is easy unto him that understandeth.
7: <sup>7</sup> Go from the presence of a foolish man, when thou perceivest not in him the lips of knowledge.
8: <sup>8</sup> The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way: but the folly of fools is deceit.
9: <sup>9</sup> Fools make a mock at sin: but among the righteous there is favour.
10: <sup>10</sup> The heart knoweth his own bitterness; and a stranger doth not intermeddle with his joy.
11: <sup>11</sup> The house of the wicked shall be overthrown: but the tabernacle of the upright shall flourish.
12: <sup>12</sup> There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.
13: <sup>13</sup> Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth is heaviness.
14: <sup>14</sup> The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man shall be satisfied from himself.
15: <sup>15</sup> The simple believeth every word: but the prudent man looketh well to his going.
16: <sup>16</sup> A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.
17: <sup>17</sup> He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.
18: <sup>18</sup> The simple inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
19: <sup>19</sup> The evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
20: <sup>20</sup> The poor is hated even of his own neighbour: but the rich hath many friends.
21: <sup>21</sup> He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth: but he that hath mercy on the poor, happy is he.
22: <sup>22</sup> Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.
23: <sup>23</sup> In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.
24: <sup>24</sup> The crown of the wise is their riches: but the foolishness of fools is folly.
25: <sup>25</sup> A true witness delivereth souls: but a deceitful witness speaketh lies.
26: <sup>26</sup> In the fear of the LORD is strong confidence: and his children shall have a place of refuge.
27: <sup>27</sup> The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.
28: <sup>28</sup> In the multitude of people is the king’s honour: but in the want of people is the destruction of the prince.
29: <sup>29</sup> He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.
30: <sup>30</sup> A sound heart is the life of the flesh: but envy the rottenness of the bones.
31: <sup>31</sup> He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker: but he that honoureth him hath mercy on the poor.
32: <sup>32</sup> The wicked is driven away in his wickedness: but the righteous hath hope in his death.
33: <sup>33</sup> Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: but that which is in the midst of fools is made known.
34: <sup>34</sup> Righteousness exalteth a nation: but sin is a reproach to any people.
35: <sup>35</sup> The king’s favour is toward a wise servant: but his wrath is against him that causeth shame.
